pr_title: #5690 use lower case for value of full calendar event.rendering

timeline.message: #5690 use lower case for value of full calendar event.rendering

timeline.bodyText: I see you are doing Objects.toString but not .toLowerCase()?
timeline.author: melloware

replies.bodyText:
That because in PrimeFaces it is an enum following java naming conventions. The ScheduleRenderingMode enum have internally the correct string for the full calendar.
.toLowerCase() would not work for ScheduleRenderingMode.INVERSE_BACKGROUND because it must resolve to 'inverse-background'.
You must call getRendering() or toString() on the enum. To be null save I use Objects.toString()
The behavior of org.json changed. In the old version it did a .toString() on all untested object types. Now it tests for enums and calls .name() on them. So now longer the internal string is used but the name.
replies.author: OBreidenbach
